choices.text:
in a javascript web app, how do you save text to a local file
You can use the `fs` module in Node.js or the `FileSaver` API for the browser to write data to a file. Here's an example using `fs`: 
```javascript
const fs = require('fs'); // assuming this is installed as a dependency of your app, and you've already imported it into your script if needed
// assume textToSave is a string or array of strings that contains the content you want to save. For instance: "Hello world!" would be saved in a file named 'hello-world.txt' 
fs.writeFile('path/to/save', Buffer.from(textToSave, 'base64'), (err) => { 
  if (!err){ console.log("Saved successfully!"); } else{ throw err; }; }); // replace path/to/save with the desired file name and location
``` 
This code writes a base-64 encoded version of `textToSave` to a local file named 'path/to/save'. You can adjust this as needed.
